name: Concrete
how_to_use: Mix with water and aggregates like sand and gravel to form concrete for foundations, walls, and pavements.
description: Concrete is a composite material made from cement, water, and aggregates. It's widely used in construction for structural components due to its durability and strength.

name: Cement
how_to_use: Used as a binding agent in concrete, mortar, or grout. Mix with sand and water for mortar or with aggregates for concrete.
description: Cement is a fine powder made from limestone, clay, shells, and silica, used as a key ingredient in making concrete and mortar.

name: Steel
how_to_use: Used for structural frames, beams, reinforcement bars (rebar), and supports in construction.
description: Steel is a metal alloy made from iron and carbon. It is widely used in construction for its high strength-to-weight ratio and ability to withstand heavy loads.

name: Rebar (Reinforcement bars)
how_to_use: Placed inside concrete structures to enhance their tensile strength. It is typically embedded within the concrete during pouring.
description: Rebar is a steel bar used in reinforced concrete to increase its strength by providing tensile strength, which concrete alone lacks.

name: Wood (Timber)
how_to_use: Used for framing, flooring, and furniture. Can be cut, nailed, or glued depending on the application.
description: Wood is a renewable material derived from trees, used extensively in construction for its versatility, ease of use, and natural appearance.

name: Bricks
how_to_use: Used for building walls, chimneys, and other structures. Mortar is used to bond them together.
description: Bricks are rectangular blocks of fired clay or concrete used in construction for building structures. They offer strength, fire resistance, and thermal insulation.

name: Blocks (Concrete or Cinder blocks)
how_to_use: Used in construction for walls, foundations, and other structures. They are stacked and bonded with mortar.
description: Concrete or cinder blocks are large, hollow or solid blocks made from cement. They are commonly used in constructing walls and foundations.

name: Drywall (Plasterboard)
how_to_use: Installed as interior walls or ceilings by attaching to wooden or metal studs. Taped and mudded at the seams.
description: Drywall is a material used for constructing walls and ceilings in buildings. It consists of a gypsum core sandwiched between paper layers.

name: Plywood
how_to_use: Used for sheathing, flooring, and furniture. Can be cut and nailed or glued together.
description: Plywood is a strong material made by gluing together thin layers of wood veneer, often used in construction for floors, walls, and roofs.

name: OSB (Oriented Strand Board)
how_to_use: Used for sheathing, flooring, and roofing. Can be nailed or screwed into place.
description: OSB is made from strands of wood pressed and bonded together. It is commonly used for sheathing in building construction due to its strength and cost-effectiveness.

name: Insulation (Fiberglass, Foam, or Cellulose)
how_to_use: Installed between walls, floors, and ceilings to improve energy efficiency and reduce noise.
description: Insulation materials, such as fiberglass, foam, and cellulose, help maintain temperature regulation within buildings by reducing heat loss or gain.

name: Glass
how_to_use: Used for windows, doors, and partitions. Can be installed in frames with glazing.
description: Glass is a transparent material used in construction for windows, doors, and decorative elements. It allows natural light into buildings while providing insulation and protection from the elements.

name: Steel Beams
how_to_use: Used for large structural support in buildings. They are placed horizontally across columns to support heavy loads.
description: Steel beams are metal supports used in construction to support large structures. They are essential for framing in high-rise buildings, bridges, and other large constructions.

name: Roofing Shingles
how_to_use: Installed on rooftops to create a waterproof barrier. Laid in overlapping rows from bottom to top.
description: Roofing shingles are overlapping pieces of material (usually asphalt or wood) that are installed on roofs to protect the structure from rain and snow.
